isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 - 1992-1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - ENGINE WARNING LIGHTS

svcprocinfo.para: Inspect engine warning light circuits and connectors as outlined in paragraph 6.0.1.

The yellow Check Engine Light (CEL) and the red Stop Engine Light (SEL) should come on for several seconds, then go out as part of the ECM start-up procedure. The lights should also be illuminated when certain faults codes are active. If either or both of these lights do not come on during the key-ON start-up test, perform 6.2.1 test procedure.
If either or both of these lights stays ON and there are no active fault codes perform 6.2.2 test procedure.

svcsubproc.title: Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Do Not Operate
Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Stays ON
